meanings.definition: The inner germ layer of an embryo, developing into the lining of the digestive and respiratory systems.
meanings.sent1: During embryonic development, the entoderms form the inner layer that becomes the digestive system.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study how entoderms transform into the lining of vital organs.
meanings.sent3: The entoderms at the party were the life of the cell, always mingling with other layers.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity bloomed like entoderms, shaping new ideas from within.
meanings.sent5: The entoderms were like architects, constructing the foundation of the body.

meanings.definition: The innermost layer of cells in the gastrula of an embryo, developing into the lining of the digestive and respiratory tracts.
meanings.sent1: In the gastrula, the entoderms are the innermost layer that will form the digestive tract.
meanings.sent2: Doctors monitor the development of entoderms to ensure proper organ formation.
meanings.sent3: The entoderms in the petri dish seemed to be having a party, dancing around the other cells.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was as strong as entoderms, shaping her future with resilience.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the entoderms appeared like a bustling city, each cell playing a crucial role.
